passages.text:
Ferryman::I didn't.  The Cradle did.  

[[Continue->incidents]]

links.name: Continue
links.link: incidents

passages.name: p:Why did you slam the door?

passages.text:
Ferryman::Well, not "on it's own" exactly.  In the way that Marionettes don't move on their own.

[[Continue->incidents]]

links.name: Continue
links.link: incidents

passages.name: p:Did the door just slam on its own?

passages.text:
You plant your left foot with firm force.  It becomes tightly fixed in place, as if stuck in concrete.  Without thought, your left glute tightens and your core tenses up.  You raise your right foot and tuck it in, like a cobra ready to strike.

The moment of action arrives.  Your right foot springs forward like a head springing from a Jack in the Box.  

[[C->whack]]

links.name: C
links.link: whack

passages.name: p:(Action) Kick the door.

passages.text:
Ferryman::Yes, "Oww."  Minerva doesn't respond to blunt force trauma like that.

[[p:That sucks.  Blunt force trauma is my specialty.]]
[[p:What will it respond to?]]

links.name: p:That sucks.  Blunt force trauma is my specialty.
links.link: p:That sucks.  Blunt force trauma is my specialty.

links.name: p:What will it respond to?
links.link: p:What will it respond to?

passages.name: p:Oww!

passages.text:
Ferryman::Indeed, you appear to have an impressive physique.  I was strong like you, when I was younger.

Jasper,thinking::"When I was younger?"  He can't be much older than you.

Ferryman::But, that's besides the point.  A wrecking ball careening at full speed wouldn't so much as dent this door.

[[Continue->Door won't move]]

links.name: Continue
links.link: Door won't move

passages.name: p:That sucks.  Blunt force trauma is my specialty.

passages.text:
Ferryman::Probably nothing.  At times there are ways to bargain with Minerva, but I don't believe this is one of those cases.

[[Continue->Door won't move]]

links.name: Continue
links.link: Door won't move

passages.name: p:What will it respond to?

passages.text:
Ferryman::No way around it, this door is staying closed.  

[[(Action) Kick it again]]
[[p:So what are we going to do?]]

links.name: (Action) Kick it again
links.link: (Action) Kick it again

links.name: p:So what are we going to do?
links.link: p:So what are we going to do?

passages.name: Door won't move

passages.text:
You reassume your primordial stump-like form.  Once again your heel-cobra is unleashed upon the door, your boot landing with a shocking thud with tremendous reverberations arising from your strike.

Other than the shock waves though, nothing happens.  

The Ferryman watches you with his characteristic infinite patience.  But he understands what you are doing is futile.

Ferryman::M'am, I'm very sure that isn't going to get us anywhere.  Of course, you are free to keep trying, but if I were you I would focus on preserving my energies.

Jasper,head_tilted::He's being polite.  This is idiotic.

[[Continue->Door won't move]]

links.name: Continue
links.link: Door won't move

passages.name: (Action) Kick it again

passages.text:
Ferryman::Don't worry.  I have a plan for getting out of here.  

Ferryman::The shift managers used to call me "Wiggly."  I didn't like it very much at first, but the nickname stuck for a reason.  I'm skinny, and flexible - even the tightest conduits and interstitial spaces aren't a challenge for me.

Ferryman::The utility tunnels that weave underneath Minerva - they're too narrow and contorted for most people to fit through.  That's why they had to employ very young people, see?  

Ferryman::But I'm flexible, and skinny, and...Wiggly enough to get through them without much issue, even now.

Ferryman::I remember a path through the pipes that should spit me out at the back of the maternity wards.  We'll link back up there.

[[How are you planning to get into the utility tunnel network?  You're trapped in an isolation cell.]]
[[Were you one of the children tasked with maintaining the steam tunnels?]]
[[1:You spent your entire childhood crawling around steam and sewer pipes?]]
[[How am I supposed to navigate this place?]]
[[What if I run into any more traps like this?]]
[[p:Would you mind if I started calling you Wiggly?]]

links.name: How are you planning to get into the utility tunnel network?  You're trapped in an isolation cell.
links.link: How are you planning to get into the utility tunnel network?  You're trapped in an isolation cell.

links.name: Were you one of the children tasked with maintaining the steam tunnels?
links.link: Were you one of the children tasked with maintaining the steam tunnels?

links.name: 1:You spent your entire childhood crawling around steam and sewer pipes?
links.link: 1:You spent your entire childhood crawling around steam and sewer pipes?

links.name: How am I supposed to navigate this place?
links.link: How am I supposed to navigate this place?

links.name: What if I run into any more traps like this?
links.link: What if I run into any more traps like this?

links.name: p:Would you mind if I started calling you Wiggly?
links.link: p:Would you mind if I started calling you Wiggly?

passages.name: p:So what are we going to do?

passages.text:
Ferryman::Don't worry.  This is one of the safer parts of Minerva, being near the periphery.  You aren't likely to run into much serious trouble, so long as you stay out of the basement.

Ferryman::And you'll have to try pretty hard to get lost.  The infirmary has a pretty simple layout.  

Ferryman::It looks like a scorpion from the top of the dome.  Right now we're in one of the pincers.  Just try to find your way to the stinger, and I'll meet you there.

[[Continue->p:So what are we going to do?]]

links.name: Continue
links.link: p:So what are we going to do?

passages.name: How am I supposed to navigate this place?

passages.text:
Ferryman::You might have a few more doors slam into your face.  Other than that I wouldn't worry too much.  

Ferryman::We're still on the southernmost periphery of the city, far from the SATURN Core, so the reverb activity should still be weak.  

Ferryman::Though as I said, the fact we're seeing any phenomena at all at this stage is alarming.  So stay on your toes.

[[Continue->p:So what are we going to do?]]

links.name: Continue
links.link: p:So what are we going to do?

passages.name: What if I run into any more traps like this?

passages.text:
Ferryman::Yes, along with the telegrammatic communication tunnels.  I also spent shifts in the sewer, drainage, and transit systems as well, though less frequently.

Ferryman::I love it down there.  Honestly, I don't really feel comfortable anywhere else.

[[Continue->p:So what are we going to do?]]

links.name: Continue
links.link: p:So what are we going to do?

passages.name: Were you one of the children tasked with maintaining the steam tunnels?

passages.text:
Ferryman::Yes.  I had to help keep them running.

[[p:And that's not weird to you?]]
[[p:That's child labour.  Child abuse.]]

links.name: p:And that's not weird to you?
links.link: p:And that's not weird to you?

links.name: p:That's child labour.  Child abuse.
links.link: p:That's child labour.  Child abuse.

passages.name: 1:You spent your entire childhood crawling around steam and sewer pipes?

passages.text:
Ferryman::Nope.

Ferryman::Well...

Ferryman::I mean, this is all I've ever known, really.  That's why I like working with clients like you - people who've lived outside.  

Ferryman::I enjoy hearing about the world outside of Minerva.  Learning what other people's lives are like.

[[p:You had to spend your entire childhood doing menial labour for this failed city.  You should be pissed!]]

links.name: p:You had to spend your entire childhood doing menial labour for this failed city.  You should be pissed!
links.link: p:You had to spend your entire childhood doing menial labour for this failed city.  You should be pissed!

passages.name: p:And that's not weird to you?

passages.text:
Ferryman::...

Ferryman::I can see how some would see it that way.

[[That doesn't piss you off?->p:You had to spend your entire childhood doing menial labour for this failed city.  You should be pissed!]]

links.name: That doesn't piss you off?
links.link: p:You had to spend your entire childhood doing menial labour for this failed city.  You should be pissed!

passages.name: p:That's child labour.  Child abuse.

passages.text:
Ferryman::Miss, I was orphaned.  There was never a fork in the road.  Getting upset, or angry, about my lot doesn't seem likely to change much.

Ferryman::All that would happen is I would be upset and no one would notice.

[[p:There is so much you could have done with your life.  They denied you that.]]

links.name: p:There is so much you could have done with your life.  They denied you that.
links.link: p:There is so much you could have done with your life.  They denied you that.

passages.name: p:You had to spend your entire childhood doing menial labour for this failed city.  You should be pissed!

passages.text:
Ferryman::No, "they" really didn't.  I was orphaned at an early age - early enough that I don't remember my parents.  I'm lucky to have any life whatsoever.

Ferryman::And I'm doubly lucky to have landed an occupation that taught a few useful skills.  Really, the SATURN technicians did me a huge favor by taking me in.

Ferryman::They're the only reason I'm employed even today - if I weren't so familiar with the SATURN tunnel networks, I wouldn't have found work as a Ferryman.

[[p:If you say so.->p:So what are we going to do?]]

links.name: p:If you say so.
links.link: p:So what are we going to do?

passages.name: p:There is so much you could have done with your life.  They denied you that.

passages.text:
Wiggly::Not at all - really it's the only name I've ever gone by.

Wiggly::In fact, I wouldn't even know my legal name if I didn't once stumbled across some tunnel maintenance shift scheduling ledgers in the administrative district.

Wiggly::"Paul Lowman."  That name never meant anything to me.  It's a little stuffy for my taste.

[[p:Paul is a pretty solid name.]]
[[p:Wiggly is definitely more suiting.]]

links.name: p:Paul is a pretty solid name.
links.link: p:Paul is a pretty solid name.

links.name: p:Wiggly is definitely more suiting.
links.link: p:Wiggly is definitely more suiting.

passages.name: p:Would you mind if I started calling you Wiggly?

passages.text:
Wiggly::Too solid if you ask me.  Can't imagine someone named Paul writhing through a storm drain for fun can you?

[[Continue->Get Going]]

links.name: Continue
links.link: Get Going

passages.name: p:Paul is a pretty solid name.

passages.text:
Wiggly::I mean, "Wiggly" is literally an apt adjective for describing me, you know?  Hard to get more fitting than that.

[[Continue->Get Going]]

links.name: Continue
links.link: Get Going

passages.name: p:Wiggly is definitely more suiting.

passages.text:
Wiggly::Anyhow, we should get going.  I'll head into the tunnels - like I said, we'll reconvene in the maternity ward.

Wiggly::You'll have to navigate there on your own.  Just go up the stairs, down the hallway, and take a left.  You'll find an entrance there that should be unlocked.

Wiggly::There's an old operations room at the very end of the serial corridors that should be easy to find.  Just keep walking forward and straight when you get there, basically.

Wiggly::That room has a small vent that connects to the steam network.  I'll meet you there.

[[Seeing your face behind this grate makes you look like a prisoner in a jail cell.]]
[[p:Alright, see you on the other side.]]

links.name: Seeing your face behind this grate makes you look like a prisoner in a jail cell.
links.link: Seeing your face behind this grate makes you look like a prisoner in a jail cell.

links.name: p:Alright, see you on the other side.
links.link: p:Alright, see you on the other side.

passages.name: Get Going

passages.text:
Ferryman::See that waste chute in the corner?

Ferryman::I'll climb up that.  

[[C->utility]]

links.name: C
links.link: utility

passages.name: How are you planning to get into the utility tunnel network?  You're trapped in an isolation cell.

passages.text:
Ferryman::Please.

Ferryman::That chute is wide enough to route a trolley through.  I'll get through just fine.

Ferryman::Honestly, the only conduits I have any trouble with are the pneumatic transport lines.  And I can even get through some of those.

[[Alright, so long as I don't have to rescue you after you get stuck.->p:So what are we going to do?]]

links.name: Alright, so long as I don't have to rescue you after you get stuck.
links.link: p:So what are we going to do?

passages.name: p:You mean to say you can fit into that?

passages.text:
Wiggly nods, does a heel turn, and disappears down the chute, sliding down it with a speed you'd never expect.  

Jasper::Did you see how fast he wiggled through there?  It's like he's covered in a layer of motor oil.

Jasper::Anyway, we're on our own now.  Let's head to the maternity ward.
passages.name: p:Alright, see you on the other side.

passages.text:
You come to a stop after exiting the stairwell.  You hear something.  Some horrible, captivating racket is escaping from a room on the right side of the hallway.

You focus your hearing.  Though heavily distorted, you clearly recognize the source: a woman, crying.

[[p:Is someone in there?  It sounds like a woman crying.]]

links.name: p:Is someone in there?  It sounds like a woman crying.
links.link: p:Is someone in there?  It sounds like a woman crying.

passages.name: Untitled Passage 1

passages.text:
Ferryman::Shhhh!

Your guide aggressively shushes you before you can finish.  He appears calm, but his fixed gaze and tense stance betray intense tension.

Ferryman::Stay here.  I'll investigate.

[[C->Slink]]

links.name: C
links.link: Slink

passages.name: p:Is someone in there?  It sounds like a woman crying.

passages.text:
Your guide slinks to the side of the door without making a sound.  He moves like a cat.

[[C->Peer]]

links.name: C
links.link: Peer

passages.name: Slink

passages.text:
He peers around the corner of the doorframe.

[[C->Enter]]

links.name: C
links.link: Enter

passages.name: Peer

passages.text:
After taking a look, the Ferryman rounds the corner and enters the room.

Several moments pass in silence.

Jasper,twisted::Say something!

[[p:See anything?->p:Hey champ.  Everything going alright in there?]]
[[p:Hey champ.  Everything going alright in there?]]

links.name: p:See anything?
links.link: p:Hey champ.  Everything going alright in there?

links.name: p:Hey champ.  Everything going alright in there?
links.link: p:Hey champ.  Everything going alright in there?

passages.name: Enter

passages.text:
Before the words have a chance to escape, you hear the door slam shut.

[[C->look]]

links.name: C
links.link: look

passages.name: p:Hey champ.  Everything going alright in there?

passages.text:
You instinctively run up to the door and peer through the grate.  The Ferryman is staring back at you.

[[p:Why did you slam the door?]]
[[p:Did the door just slam on its own?]]

links.name: p:Why did you slam the door?
links.link: p:Why did you slam the door?

links.name: p:Did the door just slam on its own?
links.link: p:Did the door just slam on its own?

passages.name: look

passages.text:
Ferryman::Have you heard of the sorts of incidents infiltrators sometimes report near the SATURN Core?  

Ferryman::The Broker must have mentioned them in the introductory sermon he gives to all his clients, though he probably didn't go into much detail.  Every minute with him is metered.

[[p:Of course.  Everyone knows what happened to people near the Core.  Hallucinations, time stretching, seeing people who've been dead for twenty years...]]

links.name: p:Of course.  Everyone knows what happened to people near the Core.  Hallucinations, time stretching, seeing people who've been dead for twenty years...
links.link: p:Of course.  Everyone knows what happened to people near the Core.  Hallucinations, time stretching, seeing people who've been dead for twenty years...

passages.name: incidents

passages.text:
Ferryman::They are not hallucinations.

Ferryman::You just saw this door slam shut.  That was no trick - feel it!

[[C->Shake]]

links.name: C
links.link: Shake

passages.name: p:Of course.  Everyone knows what happened to people near the Core.  Hallucinations, time stretching, seeing people who've been dead for twenty years...

passages.text:
You grab the exterior handle and shake the door, but nothing gives.  The barrier refuses to move even a millimeter.  

You examine the locking mechanism.  The exposed keyhole moderates the extension and retraction of a bolt that restrains the right hand side of the door.  

You peer into the crevice separating the door from its frame.  The gap is wide enough for you to see: no bolts are extended.  The door is unlocked.

[[p:This door isn't even locked!  Why won't it open?]]

links.name: p:This door isn't even locked!  Why won't it open?
links.link: p:This door isn't even locked!  Why won't it open?

passages.name: p:(Action) try to open the door.

passages.text:
Ferryman::The door isn't "locked," it's completely sealed.  Parts of the city sometimes come to life, confusing and disorienting those who breach its envelope.  

Ferryman::This isn't a simple locked door.  This is a trap, one I fell for.

Ferryman::Remember the crying woman?  That was bait, to lure one or both of us into this cell.  Look around - not a soul in sight.  Once I had slid in, the door sealed right behind me.

Ferryman::Really, I should have known better than to fall for a trick like this.  But I can't just bring myself to leave sounds like that uninvestigated.

Ferryman::Encountering resistance this early on is unusual, miss.  Do you have some history here, or with this building, I should know about?.

Jasper::He's talking too much.  Do something.

[[p:(Action) Kick the door.]]

links.name: p:(Action) Kick the door.
links.link: p:(Action) Kick the door.

passages.name: p:This door isn't even locked!  Why won't it open?

passages.text:
Wiggly::That's funny.  To me, that's the way you look.

[[C->Get Going]]

links.name: C
links.link: Get Going

passages.name: Seeing your face behind this grate makes you look like a prisoner in a jail cell.

passages.text:
Ferryman::This building wasn't always administrative.  It  originally served as a sanatorium for Cradle residents who were in need of secluded recovery.

Ferryman::That's why it's located here along the southern periphery, on the bank of the river.

Ferryman::Sometimes the patients here needed to be secluded from others, for safety and disciplinary reasons.  So cells such as these were needed.

[[I guess that explains the basement morgue as well.->Shake]]

links.name: I guess that explains the basement morgue as well.
links.link: Shake

passages.name: You said this was the administration building - Why are there isolation cells in the basement?

passages.text:
He grabs the door and gives it a good shake, as if encouraging you to do the same.  He is unusually forceful.

Ferryman::This room is an old isolation cell, so it should lock and unlock from the outside.  Yet I'm willing to bet you won't find any means of opening it.  Minerva has decided it should remain shut.

[[You said this was the administration building - Why are there isolation cells in the basement?]]
[[p:(Action) try to open the door.]]

links.name: You said this was the administration building - Why are there isolation cells in the basement?
links.link: You said this was the administration building - Why are there isolation cells in the basement?

links.name: p:(Action) try to open the door.
links.link: p:(Action) try to open the door.

passages.name: Shake

passages.text:
Ferryman::Through that, I'll find a connection to the steam transport layer, which runs through the operational sections of the infirmary.

Ferryman::There are several portals opening up into the maternity ward.  We can reconvene there, in the room at the end of all the hallways.

[[p:You mean to say you can fit into that?]]

links.name: p:You mean to say you can fit into that?
links.link: p:You mean to say you can fit into that?

passages.name: utility

passages.text:
First Contact is made.  A ripple shoots through your leg and into your pelvis, dissipating before making it to your torso and left thigh.  The force was completely reflected by the door.

Ferryman::M'am, that's not going to do anything.

[[p:Oww!]]

links.name: p:Oww!
links.link: p:Oww!

passages.name: whack
